TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

Oops, guess I am not the only one that does that

Edited April 18, 2015 by DudewHorns

When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

Nooooooooo \:confused:/
You notice a bright star, low to the horizon after sunset, and near the crescent moon, and think - oh, that'll be Eve
Then you look up in the sky and find Jool
I know I play way to much when my son asks me for advice to make bottle rockets and I want to add R10 boosters and De-couplers, Telescopes, radio and Jedidiah Kerbal to fly it straight.

When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

Oops, guess I am not the only one that does that

Lol I did that many times, event I'm quite a new player.

When you start to admire the engineering prowess it took to balance the center of mass in objects/machines that you previously took for granted. (Which is actually kind of cool, the more I think about it)
When you pursue to know about what's actually going on, and suddenly the game becomes cake.

When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

I've done that.

When you start teaching your friends and family orbital mechanics.

I've done that too.

You see Jupiter, I see Jool,

You see earth, I see Kerbin,

You see the sun, I see Kerbol

Oh god I think I'm way too addicted

I've done that too. I haven't said "the moon" for 2 months now, only "the mun".

- - - Updated - - -

Actually, about the first quote, I sometimes try to timewarp YouTube as well.

When you start to admire the engineering prowess it took to balance the center of mass in objects/machines that you previously took for granted. (Which is actually kind of cool, the more I think about it)

Yes, so much this. I look at fighter jets and airliners and keep thinking about the great minds behind the, and how difficult it must have been.

Also with RC aircraft I think the same way.

When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

Oops, guess I am not the only one that does that

When you fill the Twitch stream chat box with commas or periods when you try and timewarp.
When you figure out you are some sort of mixture of Jeb, Bob, and Bill.

Many people think they've played too much KSP when their computer overheats.

I play until Duna overheats.

... I play until Duna overheats.

http://i.imgur.com/y2fbTtbl.png

*gasp* I want a lava planet
Love how that lava mixes with the ice caps...
When you feel guilty every time you go to bed after "accidentally" destroying a rocket
When you're going to SAS hall and you can't help but think "stability augmentation system". True story.

Many people think they've played too much KSP when their computer overheats.

I play until Duna overheats.

http://i.imgur.com/y2fbTtbl.png

How did you do that ?

You know you've played too much KSP when you find yourself browsing for 5 minutes on the forum waiting on load time, then realize that the menu's been loaded for 4 and a half minutes... #OPTIMIZATIONOP

Edited April 30, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

You know you play KSP too much when your science teacher tells you to write your own myth about the sun or the MÃƒÂ¼n (sorry moon) and you write this

The KerbalsThe moon is actually the MÃƒÂ¼n, a moon which used to orbit a planet called Kerbin. On this planet lived small green creatures called kerbals. Kerbals knew about the earth and had seen primitive life forms living on it. Realising that Earth had no moons and Kerbin had two, the kerbals, kind creatures by nature, decided to re-orbit the MÃƒÂ¼n around the earth. After assembling the largest rocket ship known to Kerbal kind, the ambitious kerbonauts Bob, Bill and Jehbadiah successfully re-orbited the MÃƒÂ¼n into orbit around Earth. Having done this kind deed, the Kerbals went home, planning to come back to earth and meet the Earthlings later. However they never got round to it, having to protect their planet from several asteroids.

And that is why we have the moon.
Happens to me, ALL THE TIME

When you are watching a stream/youtube video of someone playing KSP, and try to grab the screen with your mouse to rotate the view.

Oops, guess I am not the only one that does that

Definitely count me in for this one too. I do it all the time.

That reminds me, how cool would it be to have a recording system in KSP where you really could do that? Like it would record all the physics, and a viewer could rotate and switch cameras while it plays back.
You know you play KSP to much when you try to use the 1, 2, 3 and 4 keys to switch edit modes in Blender.

You know you play too much KSP and binge watch too much Farscape when you have a dream where you are trying to help the crew of Moya by building an object out of KSP parts and showing them maneuver nodes.

You know you play too much KSP and binge watch too much Farscape when you have a dream where you are trying to help the crew of Moya by building an object out of KSP parts and showing them maneuver nodes.

ROFL! Nice one!
